trans-unit.source: Aggregate functions perform a calculation on a set of values and return a single value.
trans-unit.target: Aggregate functions perform a calculation on a set of values and return a single value.

trans-unit.source: Except for the COUNT function, aggregate functions ignore null values.
trans-unit.target: Except for the COUNT function, aggregate functions ignore null values.

trans-unit.source: Aggregate functions are frequently used with the GROUP BY clause of the SELECT statement.
trans-unit.target: Aggregate functions are frequently used with the GROUP BY clause of the SELECT statement.

trans-unit.source: This means aggregate functions return the same value any time that they are called by using a specific set of input values.
trans-unit.target: This means aggregate functions return the same value any time that they are called by using a specific set of input values.

trans-unit.source: Note that you may have no more than 14 aggregates per query.
trans-unit.target: Note that you may have no more than 14 aggregates per query.

trans-unit.source: Aggregate functions can be used as expressions only in the following:
trans-unit.target: Aggregate functions can be used as expressions only in the following:

trans-unit.source: The select list of a SELECT statement (either a subquery or an outer query).
trans-unit.target: The select list of a SELECT statement (either a subquery or an outer query).
